item.title: Using Netcat For File Transfers
item.author: thiklab@gmail.com (Thik)
item.description: Netcat is like a swiss army knife for geeks. It can be used for just about anything involving TCP or UDP. One of its most practical uses is to transfer files. Non *nix people usually don’t have SSH setup, and it is much faster to transfer stuff with netcat then setup SSH. netcat is just a single executable, and works across all platforms (Windows,Mac OS X, Linux). On the receiving end running,
item.dc:creator: thik

item.title: Self Signed Certification for Code Signing
item.author: thiklab@gmail.com (Thik)
item.description: In order to use a non deprecated way to sign your own script, one should use New-SelfSignedCertificate. Generate the Key 1 2 # Make sure you run as Administrator New-SelfSignedCertificate -DnsName email@yourdomain.com -Type CodeSigning -CertStoreLocation cert:\CurrentUser\My Export Certification Without Private Key 1 Export-Certificate -Cert (Get-ChildItem Cert:\CurrentUser\My -CodeSigningCert)[0] -FilePath code_signing.crt The [0] will make this work for cases when you have more than one certificate. Obviously make the index match the certificate you want to use or use a way to filtrate (by thumprint or issuer).
item.dc:creator: thik
